Text: Hurricane Connie:  After affecting Puerto Rico, Connie turned to the northwest, reaching peak winds of 140 mph (220 km/h).

Text: Hurricane Connie:  The hurricane weakened while slowing and turning to the north, and struck North Carolina on August 12 at Category 2 intensity, the first of three damaging tropical cyclones in the 1955 Atlantic hurricane season to hit the state.
